intro: Hieracium cacomedes, commonly known as the blighted hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its yellow to orange composite flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough, hairy texture. Hieracium cacomedes is an herbaceous perennial that can form dense colonies, making it both a common weed and a plant of ecological interest.
